learning_outcomes.description: Apply core theoretical macroeconomic models to explain real world macroeconomic phenomena.
Show how aggregate macroeconomic activity is shaped by microeconomic behaviour and equilibrium restrictions.
Identify key contemporary macroeconomic issues and discuss possible solutions towards improving current policies.
Illustrate the trade-offs present in designing fiscal and monetary policy over the short/medium term.
Collect, analyse, and interpret macroeconomic data from Australia and the rest of the world.

assessments.task_description:
The Online Quiz consists of various questions which assess the understanding of the topics studied in class. This quiz aims to test your preliminary understanding of the topics to support your learning and provide feedback at an early point in the semester.

The topics covered in the Online Quiz will be communicated via Blackboard.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Enter answers into Blackboard/Turnitin by the due date and time.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
This will be a 60-minute exam with 10 minutes perusal.

The exam will consist of short answer and problem-solving questions.

The topics covered in the In-Semester Exam will be communicated via Blackboard.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of any generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools is not permitted. Any attempted use of Generative AI may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

assessments.task_description:
The Assignment consists of problem solving, essay, and/or short answer questions which assess the understanding of the topics studied in class. Collection, manipulation, and interpretation of macroeconomic data may be also required. 

The topics covered in the Assignment will be communicated via Blackboard.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The assignment must be submitted electronically via Blackboard/TurnitIn.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:

The exam will be held during the central examination period at a day/time set by Examinations Section.

The exam will cover all topics from lectures and tutorials and will include multiple choice, short answer and problem solving questions.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of any generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools is not permitted. Any attempted use of Generative AI may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
